conclusion: Understand the flow of liquid through the baffles to determine which container (D or E) the liquid will flow into.
The image shows different colored liquids flowing through baffles labeled A, B, and C.
The liquids are directed by the baffles towards containers D and E.
Liquid A flows through the blue baffle and is directed towards container D.
Liquid B flows through the green baffle and is directed towards container E.
Liquid C flows through the yellow baffle and is directed towards container D.
In the first image, the liquids are shown flowing through the baffles.
In the second image, the liquids are shown entering the containers.
In the third image, the liquids are shown in their final positions in the containers.
Liquid A and C both flow into container D.
Liquid B flows into container E.
